summary:
A young mechanical engineer at ASML and a MSc. graduate from the department of Mechanical Engineering at the TU Delft. I have a passion for thermal and fluids in Mechanical Engineering. I have a background in experimental and modelling aspects in these areas.

My friends and colleagues know that I am meticulous and thorough with my work. I usually get absorbed in the work that I do and come up with creative solutions. I am strong willed and determined to achieve the goals that I have set for myself.

You can contact me via:
1. Email:    hazari.aaquib@gmail.com
2. Phone:  +31684687823

awards.title: Finalist at the PHILIPS Innovation Award (PHIA) 2014.
awards.description:
Designed a business plan for a non-invasive touch based glucose monitoring system. 
1. Described in detail the the finances for 3 years.
2. Identified the key players in the market.
3. Identified threats and weaknesses

awards.title: Finalist of Old Guard Oral Presentation Competition
awards.description:
Represented ASME's 'District J' at the International Mechanical Engineering Congress and Exposition (IMECE) at Denver, Colorado, 2011. 
Presented the idea of a 'Solar Convection Tower'; a structure that requires only convection to be able to generate power equivalent to that of a thermal power plant.

projects.title: Heat transfer study in a solar photovoltaic (PV) system
projects.description:
Temperature effects on solar panels reduce the efficiency of the panel by about 8-12%. The optimum temperature for the working of a solar panel is around 20°C. To keep the panel cool heat exchangers can be attached below the PV panel. 

Using COMSOL, simulations of different scenarios was done  for Air, Water and Freon as the flowing fluid. The effects for changing channel dimensions, changing velocities of the fluid flows and usage of different insulators was also investigated.

After simulations water turns out to be the best solution for a faster heat transfer. However, having a continuous flowing water channel can be much more expensive than using an air channel.

An economic study for the same can prove to be vital in knowing which channel is cost-effective as per the required power output.

projects.title: Possible Implementation of Waste to Energy Plants in the UAE
projects.description:
The requirements for land area and energy is a direct result of the population boom .

A simple solution to both these problems is a 'Waste to Energy' (WTE) power plant.  
Our team developed an economical study on the viability of a WTE power plant which could be set up in Abu Dhabi.

After taking different factors into consideration like feed supplied, energy output and pollution control mechanisms we arrived at a plausible output. 

However, there is room for improvement as different assumptions had been taken into account during calculations.

contributors.headline: Sustainable Finance & Impact | Product & Business Development | Systems & Strategy

projects.title: Generation of Hydrogen Fuel Using Solar Power
projects.description:
There is an immense need for hydrogen powered vehicles in the world. Obtaining hydrogen fuel is not an easy task. There are numerous control elements involved in the production of this. 

The thesis conducted looks at the different elements involved with the process. Hydrogen production rate from a solar panel depends on different parameters. The ones chosen for the calculations are Current, Voltage, Solar Irradiation and Temperature of the Electrolyser.

After the data had been collected, the sensitivity for the production rate of hydrogen had been calculated with the help of a mathematical method, known as 'Taguchi's Method'. 

The results showed that production rate was most affected by Current flowing through the electrolyser.

profile_positions.description:
The goal is to ensure reticle and wafer defects are reduced significantly in the EUV scanner with the help of active flows. 

It is a techno-leadership role that requires high-level system knowledge as well as the ability to deep-dive on a topic with a team. 

My list of responsibilities include:
 - Maintaining high level documentation regarding the operating specifications and design decisions for the flow choices
 - Leading the flow solution packages to reduce the reticle and wafer defects
 - Improving the correlation between particle modelling and experiments in extremely low vacuum     environments
 - Ensuring that the knowledge is transferred cross-functionally between different projects.
profile_positions.title: Defectivity Flow Architect

profile_positions.description:
Modelling flow within the Scanner Environment of the EUV System
- Performing flow and pressure simulations using STARCCM+ to guide the design choices of hardware
- Predicting behaviour of particles and providing input to FMEAs
profile_positions.title: Computational Fluid Dynamics Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Overall technical and knowledge owner of the Cooling System for the EUV Source.
- Defined the architecture of the cooling system to fulfill customer requirements on flow and pressure
- Guided the hardware choices on a roadmap level by making data driven conclusions
- Documented the specs of the system with regular alignment from stakeholders 
- Conducted FMEAs and design reviews to ensure the risks are identified and mitigation action plans are in place
- Defined test plans to ensure a robust final product was delivered to the customer
- Modelled flow and pressure networks to provide guidance on cooling architecture
- Resolved escalations by providing technical solutions in the form of action plans
profile_positions.title: Cooling Architect EUV Source

profile_positions.description:
Gas architect in the EC&I department of the EUV machine.
•	Increased availability of the EUV source. Customer savings > €200,000. Implemented with 6 sigma 
        concepts
•	Ran pressure & flow measurement tests in cleanroom grade environment 
•	Modelled the pressure drop for P&IDs using 1D softwares
•	Modelled & validated the exhaust system using Star CCM+ 
•	Maintained/Updated documentation of different EUV source module
profile_positions.title: Gas Analyst

profile_positions.description:
1. Performed Pressure Ignition tests to obtain the safety limitations for the home boiler. Used the concepts of FMEA to identify and resolve problem areas.
2. Validated various spark plug and glow plug designs to ensure stable ignition. This included short tests and lifetime tests as well. 
3. Created a dynamic modular design for the home boiler using interdisciplinary principles of thermodynamics and control engineering using Simulink & MATLAB. Fundamental equations such as mass and energy balances were derived for each module.
profile_positions.title: Development Engineer

profile_positions.description:
1. Understand Multiphase Flows
2. Described the shortcomings of the Lockhart-Martinelli Parameter and suggested possible improvements
3. Addition of Froude number dependence on the Lockhart-Martinelli Parameter improved the results for stratified two phase flow
